data.text: No longer works for tablets? Google stated "this app no longer works for tablets." Not sure if that means ALL tablets or just mine. In any case, Google said to use a web browser instead. Never thought of that! A web page is far less impactful than an app and honestly, in this case, the app provides nothing you can't get from the web page version!

The app hasn't worked well for almost 2 weeks. Products will not load when clicking on recently viewed items or special buys. I can add items to the cart and the number of items on the cart icon rises, but it will not load and instead gives an error screen. I experience no issues visiting the website through the Chrome app. I have cleared cache, app storage, forced stop, uninstalled, and reinstalled...This isn't new, the app often experiences failure & bugs.

I have never been able to log into my account. All I get is a spinning circle, I've tried turning off my Wi-Fi, turning off my VPN, pretty much everything. I download it every once in awhile. hoping there's been an update that fixes this issue, but to no avail. Without being able to log in, I might as well use my phone's web app since it works better. This app has no value or efficient usage. I'd give this zero stars if I could.

Getting to your account & credit card information is wonky at best. I always end up having to use the internet citi bank site to get to the last payment & statements information page. The app is best mainly for making an order or searching for products and even then, the discounts shown aren't always calculated the same as in the store, nor are the prices.

Great place for most of your needs. Friendly staff, always willing to help! But the app sucks... no way to filter for instore items...you have to click on an item to check to see if they have it in store or you have to order it. It would also be great if you could see similar compatible parts if the part you want is not available. I had to change my rating due to frustration ðŸ«¤.

Valuable, but imperfect. I use this app every day so I'm a heavy user of it. The biggest issue right now is that often the in-store location (aisle, bay) doesn't show up when it's supposed to. This is frustrating. Also, the price often doesn't show up. It's the space below the product image and above the pickup/delivery option that often fails to display. Otherwise, it's incredibly useful to make a shopping list, access reviews, check order status, check in stock status, etc.

This app is useful but not always. It will often fail to load (or load very slowly) the prices and different options available for individual items. You can see the listing and the page, but the price won't load. If you want to see price and options, you need to go to the mobile HD site through your browser. Just recently it has stopped displaying prices for any items displayed after a search. It is still great for looking up past purchases and for scanning items in store. It used to be great

No matter where I am, in store, at home, or on the job. This site is slow, and the search function is almost useless. It constantly tells me the search has "0 results" and then when I just look at the category for what I'm searching for, the product is right there, and it's named what I searched for. I hate that when I go to use the website on my phone, it immediately sends me to the app without asking. I'll be deleting the app in hopes that the website is better.

Utter TRASH. Whatever you've done to add AI has completely ruined the user experience. I just wanted to search for a wire brush to see if my local store carried it. Instead all search brings is an essay about wire brushes and how I might interact with the wire brush family. I JUST WANT TO CHECK STOCK! But nope, you gotta make it harder for me to want to give you money. Nice work.

It just keeps getting worse. The app keeps signing me out and deleting my cart or will say "no internet connection" even when I'm [obviously] on my phone and have service and have wifi that works in other apps. It's incredibly frustrating and I have had to start using the website on my desktop computer. The app is up to date and so is my phone. 3/2024 update: their ordering system is messed up and I can't even place an order for home delivery. Customer service doesn't care to log the issue.

From a product managers point of view, The Home Depot app is doing a LOT and doing it well! only thing I could not accomplish today was return a $6 item -- but probably there's a way to do that, too, but I didn't think to look for it! Little bit sluggish on the checkout form, and Add to Favorites from List View was wonky on Android (felt like a double tap and never "took"), but individual items Add to List worked fine.

I don't like because it in Not showing my invoice, specially the online orders. it takes long time to find it where is the invoices. it must be quick visible , easy to find it. home Depot stopped sending invoices to my email, which is bad idea. instead of making better you are making worst. the useful taps are hidden deep somewhere. like find my invoices. you are thinking only about adds . tons of adds on the pages

Overall a good app because it allows me to research product options and I definitely appreciate how I can filter what's available to pick up in store right away. Only reason I dinged one star is that the app tends to freeze any time you remove something from your cart and requires closing, then reopening the app. That part is super annoying and I'm not sure if it's just a bug with the app or something else.

Worse and worse. I keep getting notifications that I have messages, but every time I attempt to access them, I get 'problem reaching message center'. This is so annoying, I'm ->||<- this close to deleting it. This isn't recent either. This has been happening for literally years. Either fix your 'message center', or STOP messaging me. Or I start going to Lowes, which is 2 blocks closer anyhow, and whose app works.

This was a nearly perfect app until the last update. While it looks amazing, it now removes the locations of each item within the store. It now requires you to click on each individual item to see where they are located. That is difficult to do inside the store considering poor internet service or lack of signal from cell phone tower. Its also more time consuming. Either return shopping list to previous design or add the items location within the store to each item in list as was before.

The fact that the app barely works or not down inside the stores should rate it lower but I do appreciate being able to navigate and switch between devices. I can send lists to customers. I can check prices. It would be nice to have more intuitive searches using more pro lingo. I don't know how to make in store shopping item locations more accurate but that would be nice as it's my favorite feature. Overall, I love using the app. I just wish it was less glitchy.

website and the App are the absolute WORST of any retailer out there. It takes 6 to 14 seconds to move from one item in my shopping list or shopping cart to another item no matter where I am, whether I'm using a phone or a computer. I've tried shutting down my browser and restarting. I've tried shutting down the Home Depot App and restarting. I've tried shutting down the phone/computer and restarting. Nothing works. Get rid of your 2000s Java Script and rewrite your website and App!!!!

This App is the worst App I've ever used, and I shop online weekly. There was constant glitching and freezing. I had to log out and back in, plus refresh the page several times. Home Depot has wonderful products, but what does it matter if the customer is unable to complete a purchase or grows frustrated and decides to look on Amazon, Walmart, or Lowe's.

the interface for shopping in the app is terrible now. Just to load your shopping cart is enough to make the app look like it's going to crash. The new in-store mode that was added recently seems to be what's caused the app seemingly malfunction in it performance. Store mode is cool, as it helps u locate items. But the app just doesn't function smoothly as a whole anymore.

Thanks for making the app incompatible with my tablet with the latest version. You guys have saved me so much money since you made it much more difficult to check specials daily and needed supplies quickly and efficiently on a daily basis. Seriously...... Not sure who thought removing tablet compatibility was a good idea but they'd fix it or be fired if they were working for me.

Definitely switch off updates which lock you out just as you go shopping. I usually delete this app after use because it is so worthless. If it could just simply tell me what aisle the product is on would improve usability 1000%. Also, no idea why it keeps saying no Internet connection when both wifi and cell are connected.

App had problems before, but I decided to give it another try since I need some work done. Downloaded and installed the app but still after several months, this app does not work. The app seems to work ok, until you try to access your account, it just sits there trying to connect, but it never does. It is amazing how Home Depot is willing to loose customers by not addressing the app problems...ðŸ™„

HATE this app! This app is so frustratingly horrible!! It is extremely rare for anything I select to load completely and this has been a problem for as long as I have had the app, which is at least a few years. For some stupid reason I keep holding onto hope that eventually the app will just work but if it hasn't been fixed by now it probably never will be.

The home depot app is trash. Total waste of time. I reluctantly tried using the app to purchase almost 1k worth of items, the app freezes and lags so much I had to call customer service twice, who are also mostly useless. The items I was able to purchase were spread across multiple stores, not available after payment, or to be delivered in WEEKS. I'll just go to lowes.

It's honestly surprising how much money home depot is comfortable losing with how poorly this app works. It forces me out of a browser window into the app to access information and then the app stalls and fails to to load the information and in general the app stalls out doing almost anything. Super frustrating and leads me to look elsewhere for products. It is helpful in store when it decides to work.

Terribly lagging. Wi-Fi 5G it doesn't make a difference. It's always been hankey, but the last 2-3 months of this app have literally sucked. The web browser no issue whatsoever. The app practically uses at times. Other times it can take literally a minute and a half to load up a page of a product. There is no reason to wait 90 full seconds to tap on a screen to get results. Particularly when the web browser has no issue whatsoever. Assumed the app was just a mirror of the browser but guess not.

The one feature that I used this app for has been taken away. It was nice to be able to search for an item and determine the aisle that it's located in before going into the store. It looks like that ability is now done in "store mode". This mode doesn't work until you are in the store. Unfortunately I lose my cell phone connection when I walk into my closest HD. So now I'm back to wandering the aisles looking for things or trying to find an associate that can point me to the location.

It won't let you log in! Every time it requires a login to do something; you put in the email and it gives an error message "temporary technical issues" and there isn't anything you can do. It doesn't even give you an option for the password. Uninstall/reinstall or cache clearing doesn't work. The store doesn't deal with app issues. Super annoying especially when you have ProExtra perks to use or are wanting to check your account. App cust. service email give an auto reply; inbox not monitored

I really want this to be good, but when trying to check out, the app is super slow and not very intuitive. Also, when performing 2 factor authentication, if you leave the app to get your code in email, it resets, which is probably the most irritating thing ever,meaning you have to be next to another device to get the code and authenticate. A few simple enhancements could really make for a much easier user experience. I've given up several times to hop over to Amazon out of frustration....

â­â­â­â­â­ I recently made a purchase on the Home Depot app, and the experience was fantastic! The user-friendly interface made navigation a breeze, and the extensive product range exceeded my expectations. The checkout process was seamless, and I appreciated the timely updates on my order status. The app's convenience and efficiency have definitely earned it a 5-star rating in my book. Highly recommended for all your home improvement needs!

This app is a lifesaver when trying to find the aisle/bay for an item. Unfortunately, it is very clunky when trying to use it for shopping, sometimes adding items as a ship-to-home and sometimes as a pickup; changing items to the correct delivery method (or changing quantities) requires the app to refresh between each item, making it a several minute process if there are lots of items in the cart. Invariably, the app requires receipt of a new user code to pull up the ProExtra code at checkout.

billing system has been buggy for weeks. I've been trying to buy an item and could not get the checkout page to load. worse still, when I tried to order from the website on my phone, it overrides and takes me back to the buggy app. get it fixed, guys. Amazon doesn't make it hard to purchase my cart.

Same as everyone's experience, terrible app. Just updated, so I was optimistic it may actually start working, but nope. Should not get 1 star as it's essentially non-functional. Can't add anything to the cart, and everything is buggy. I've gotten in the habit of just shopping elsewhere if I'm shopping online because it's not worth the time or trouble.

extremely buggy, constantly kicks me out, and always crashes when in a home depot store for some reason. also - they have several different inventory and order management systems, none of which play nicely together, so it's always an hours long series of phonecalls fixing mistaken orders. also, the app randomly forgets your cart. on top of that, the in stock feature rarely is accurate and the items i need are typically out of stock or the app will order from the wrong store. product nightmare.

The biggest issues I have with this app is when ordering, canceling or tracking orders of any kind. The system is not very intuitive and is difficult to use. In many cases when searching for orders the system will lock up. Some of these problems extend to web-based systems as well. Leading me to believe that the issue may be with the Home Depot servers in general versus app specific.

What a resource hog of an app. No need for all the flashy looking garbage. Not even all of it even loads slow because of how it looks, but more of how your developer designed the app. I'm too busy to have to wait for all of the fancy graphics to load. Not sure why some of you companies feel the need to have things ultra fancy looking at the expense of customer convenience for. Not all of us can afford $1,000 smart phones to be able to have all the fancy garbage loading smoothly and quickly.

Riddled with issues, some fairly serious. *Serious, scary problems*: PayPal credentials are entered *in app*. This is 100% unacceptable. The correct protocol is to send the user out to a full browser to enter credentials, then receive confirmation back in the app. They host the login instead. *Small annoyances*: no cursor in search boxes, hard-to-find cart removal link. *Functional issues*: absolutely requires network even to show existing cart, pro ID, etc. Store Wi-Fi often not good enough.

Slow to load, faster to use website. Worst part is that link from email to check in for pickup or manage the order does not work at all. It opens the HD app and displays "Error connecting" w/prompt to retry. Retrying many times doesn't work. Same error through multiple updates of HD app, or email client. Also errors out even when using email in browser, either same or sends to play store to download HD app that is already on phone. HD solely relying now on app check in, is making things worse.

app is very slow and lags in between selections and screen taps. it feels like an app that was made on outdated software or platform, but looks visually appealing. it is by far the slowest and clunkiest app I have ever used. the fact that when I tap on a product it shows a SKU or database ID number in the product name box for a second or two of it send to be slowly referencing something.

I am always hesitant about apps. Some are not even worth their "salt." However, I give each a benefit of a doubt then evaluate their usage value. I will say this ..C'mon Man! HD I tried your app...I'd your cellphone data connection is at 96 dBm or better then or works. That is unacceptable when I have great LTE at 103 dBm AND every other app & browsers have no issues. It's either the app or the servers. Need to fix!

The app GENERALLY works well. It can show whether items are in stock and if so, the shelf location in the store. You can order and pay for pickup and delivery items inside the app. (Hint: even if you're in the store but cannot wait for someone to retrieve an item on a high shelf, order and pay in the app and come back when you're notified.) I have noticed sometimes the app gets sluggish when you're switching to other apps to compare prices. Imagine that! ðŸ˜‰

It offers you options even when not available (such as if something is shippable or deliverable and it's not. It errors out and won't tell you which item is the issue.) very frustrating to try to place orders on. great for comparing prices and seeing if something is probably in-stock (although, it's definitely not 100% accurate there either.)

Worst app possible. For every one tome that it works, there are 8 times that it give some random no connectivity message. It's quicker just to walk randomly through the store and find whatever you are looking for. You cam forget looking up past purchases or jobs in the pro account. I'm not sure that I've ever been able to. I always end up getting the pro desk or customer service to look it up for me.

Won't open searches correctly, when I add items to my cart it either freezes or tells me I have no Internet connection, and when I try to check out, it just never gets past "Securing Connection". If I attempt to login to my account, I get a "There'e a temporary technical issue" message, except it's been happening for days now. Useless. I'm absolutely baffled that someone at Home Depot used this app, and allowed it to be used by the public. I'm trying to spend money and can't ðŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸

App tends to have several issues, last time I made a purchase, carpet the app wouldn't allow me to check out the store wouldn't allow me to get the item for the price, I received a refund from support for another item to compensate the difference. Today I ordered 4 items, 2 to be shipped, 2 to pick up. Again it wouldn't allow me to check out, so I'm putting in 2 orders. Apps should make things convenient, this one creates more inconvenience in reality.

The app is slow and unresponsive. I've spent years trying to avoid the baffling tendency of my online orders being assigned to Redmond Washington for pickup because it's 4 hours away and I have never been there. Alas, HD is insistent that at least 20% of my orders should go there. App crashes and loses purchase and rewards information which is reflected on my account causing loss of rewards and loss of any proof of purchases.

When it works, it's good. When it doesn't, it's annoying. I've been having a hard time linking my HD credit card to the app. I did it the other day. I tried checking it out again while I'm waiting on a delivery order. Now it tells me nothing is linked again. When I click the link for Link and Pay it gives an error message. You also get some errors when searching for products sometimes.

Slow clunky interface that randomly gives me a 400 error. It is also confusing trying to find the location of an item in-store. There should be a label on all items before clicking that shows if it is available in store or not, so I don't have to click around through item descriptions to find out.

I have never had anything but trouble trying to do things online with Home Depot! a friend told me I should download the app and then I wouldn't have so much trouble. I did as he suggested, and downloaded the app. lo and behold, no change; I still have all kinds of major problems and issues with Home Depot's online services! everything from being super super slow, to and solicited shifts to other screens, not accepting address, assigning stores nowhere near me! many more issues but no room to...

data.userName: John â€œGet Off My Lawnâ€ Hoit
data.text: Couldn't even log into my account at first install. Seems like they don't want my money. The app claimed that my password has expired and they need to send a verification code by email. After that failed 4 times because of a "technical issue". I also couldn't sms or have them call me for that verification because it would only send to an old phone I no longer have. All options exhausted, I gave up. It's official... this app sucks.

The worst app ever. The search doesn't work, it won't load, the scanner is inaccurate, you have to make an account just to use the damn thing. I tried clearing the storage, I used wifi plus mobile data, I gave it every chance to redeem itself, because I shop at Home Depot so frequently. I thought it would help me find what I need faster, but all it did was waste my time.ðŸ‘ŽðŸ¼

had a nightmare trying to order a pickup but it never texted my cell. so I drove down to the store, walked all over getting the various items, went to check out and it declined my credit card. had to abandon those items. came hone and called my credit card, and they had to cancel the online chg that I did initially that never finalized. I was able to place my order online, asking it be delivered. got the phone text this time. I could have bought these items on Amazon alot quicker & easier!

home Depot sucks! Delivered items are always broken. "Order ready for pickup" does not mean your order is ready for pickup. Be ready to spend an hour waiting for someone to find it. Inventory on the website is not the same as actual inventory. Online ordering was supposed to save time. It's faster to pick the order yourself.

I used to use this app regularly, however it apparently is no longer supported on tablets! Why! The one device I use more then any other - including my phone, and you thought it was a great idea to just stop allowing it to work on a tablet? Thank you Home Dumbo for your thoughtfulness about your customers! It still installs on a tablet, you just can't use it once it is! Please take this "App" and shove it where the sun don't shine! The App AND the rest of your services! Thanks for nothing!

App is now horrible. First, it will no longer work on tablets. Second, it's s.l.o.w.! (And I have a fancy Samsung phone, so.....) Third, when you have a list of items you're looking at and click on one, when you finish and go back to the list it either goes wayyyy back to the very beginning of page 1, or it takes you all the way to the TOP of the page you'd been on, meaning you now have to scroll all the way down to get back to where you actually left off. And things are shown more than once!

So many issues with this app. Firstly, it's incompatible with my galaxy tablet. It redirects you to the website, then the website demands that you remove the app before continuing. The phone app, for some reason, works fine... until you enter the store. The metal roof blocks all cell reception, forcing you to use their public wifi, exposing you to hackers and viruses. I'm always amazed at how little thought goes into the design of these sites. We're talking about major corporations here.

It's much worse than using a browser to visit their website. There's no tab functionality - if you leave a tab, you have to start over. It also erases all text when leaving the app - I tried to fill in some boxes and when I went to copy over an order number it deleted everything; you need to either have it written down or memorized or something. I also started getting email spam, which is always annoying - I just bought a toilet, no I don't want to buy another toilet! What nonsense is this?

The cart is horrible. The app is fine, but the cart is so painfully slow. Updating anything in the cart is excruciating. There is either not enough processing power on the backend to update instantaneously or the code is so bloated that it cannot work quickly. Either one of those is a very big and basic error. Very unprofessional. I'm very surprised it had been allowed to be this bad for so long.

All of the sudden, no notice, not compatible with tablets. Some of us hate trying to look at stuff on a tiny phone screen when we don't have to. And, it's still available for installation from the play store. Rude and confusing.

Totally useless. App no longer works at all. Says tablets no longer supported Shop online. Tried shopping online, that would not run either. Big slow app. Hangs often, starting, loading product descriptions, accessing MyLists. . Searched for 'Whirlpool built-in dishwasher' displayed 4 sinks. Hard to navigate too many touch areas. Need an app for shopping .. App gets slower each update. Now shop online using Menards app which works very well. Runs poorly on my phone also.

Ship to store is selected since no delivery option. Online and in app keeps saying "We're sorry, please provide the delivery and handling details for order items to place the order" and won't let me go beyond that. It doesn't have the option to select those things anywhere and keeps asking for my address, plus it's ship to store, so why do I even need delivery and handling details? Isn't it supposed to be delivered to the store? It's also glitching when inputting information. Waste of time

The latest version of this app is the worst yet. I know my local store (Arnold, MO) carries 1"Ã—6"Ã—8' cedar boards, but I can't look up the price of them now matter how I word my search. And it's not just that one particular item, it's multiple items that I've seen in store that fail to come up in my results. Maybe the Home Depot app designers need to get with the Lowes app design team and take a class on how to make an app that works well

freezes whenever you adjust quantity of an item in your cart, the more items the worse it gets. seems to also freeze or be unavailable randomly as well. no a reliable app. Too bad really, it has potential for sure.

I dont like having to sign up for an account. I will now likely get junk email. I just wanted to make a purchase because what I needed was only at home depot. After going to the store to order the individual helping me said it would arrive quicker if I ordered online than through the store. Seems odd.

Ok, first the app is generally good. But this nonsense making me verify via email every single time I open this app is absolutely annoying. Fix this or I'm going somewhere else. Just too many steps that are not necessary. Ps: do not order online for pickup, it takes a full day when you could have walked in in 5 mins.

Horrible! I can't see my in store receipts @ all. The app tells me there are technical difficulties but it has no problem showing me my online receipts all the way back to 2018. I hate that I can't access the info I need. Maybe home depot should go back to regular paper receipts instead of these wax receipts that fade over time

Took a somewhat functional app and turned it into utter garbage. I don't know if they're trying to be trendy, but the whole interface is horrible now and harder to use. Pretty much useless as a tool to check local stock now.

I value the military discount and base my app rating on how easily the discount can be applied and whether it can be applied online and in the self-checkout lane. Using the military discount with this app is more difficult than others, because the required QR code is unnecessarily buried. Make it easier! Befuddled at how to find the QR code, I asked the associate in the self-checkout aisle if she knew how to find it. "No one does," she said. She then set the terminal to accept my phone # for ID.

I love my home depot. it's ALWAYS clean as a whistle and there is ALWAYS an employee there to help. most of the time I get approached because I'm a woman I guess. they must think I can't use their app to figure out where things are lol. only thing I don't like is the parking lot isn't as bright as I'd like it to be. most of the time there is only 1 light out there and it doesn't make me feel relaxed, if you know what I mean... other then that it's great and always stocked. ording online is cool2

Home Depot has some of the Best Customer Service that I have seen. I like the fact that one can go in and get your lumber cut to the specific length you need for free for first 5 cuts or so and then it is only a $1 per cut aftet that. I find extremely handy when one has limited space in a vehicle. They have have a huge selection of plants all year round as well. Not to mention good prices on appliances Not to mention good prices on power tools Not to mention good prices ... well on everything

I love my Home Depot app! It makes finding items NOT in the store easier to order. It's great for finding items in the store as well. Sometimes the stock count is off though. You can call customer service up until 2:00 a.m. EST to get a live agent for help if needed. My 1st attempt couldn't understand my issue and left me on hold, but EDUARDO was GREAT, even @ 1:30am, very pleasant and PATIENT. He is a GREAT customer service rep! My order was placed with EDUARDO's help! He knows his stuff! ðŸ˜

Just order the glue up shower walls. it's a breeze. The only thing I don't like is that these wall panels come in a set of 2, and I just need 3 pieces, and I can't order 3- I just can't split up the second order, inconvenient.

I decided to take a chance and renovate my apartment so I can rent it out. This time around I'm doing the work myself instead of paying contractors. Overall, Home Depot proved to be superior with fair prices and inventory. I like that I can almost buy everything I need in one place. Sometimes there are items I can find cheaper elsewhere, but when you factor in time and other expenses you're really not saving that extra dollar.

Home Depot is like my second home. It's my goto for tools, supplies, plants, decorations, fixtures, appliances. My only complaint is with the app. Even though I set my home store to Seminole, products I search for come up in Largo, which was my original home store. I have reinstalled the app with no change in this behavior.

While delivery services have increased at every level Home Depot has not let me down. I appreciate the ability to have most of their inventory available for home delivery and even the items that can only be shipped their appx delivery date is usually delivered earlier, even on Sundays. ðŸ™‚ Even as I right this review, I am going to order items to repair our hot water heater. Wish me luck, I a newly self proclaimed DIY expert. ðŸ¤£

Logging into either website or especially app for Pro account is painful. Either works (sometimes) or has a technical issue (usually). Just a trash product, truly expect something of a higher caliber from them.

Accessing home depot credit card and making payments is extremely complicated. Click here, scroll down, click there, swipe right, click here, scroll some more. Why is this so complicated??? I shouldn't have to work that hard to make a payment!!

Slower than molasses. Every screen took 10-15 seconds to load. It seemed like you could eventually find the item you needed to, but eventually the app just froze on me. App deleted... Just use your internet browser..

This app almost never works ðŸ‘ when I try searching it shows my results then they instantly go away. I'm a pro member and try to use the pro membership benefits and can't search my jobs by PO, it doesn't show all of the receipts associated with that job just some of them or sometimes none at all.
Can't have pick up options sync with ALL ordered materials. Can't split orders into more than one payment method. Can't view all items on one page. This app needs some work!

Not happy with the store. They wouldn't let me pay for it in the store with the app price?? Apparently the store can't match the company's app price?? I waited 45min for them to pull it off the shelf and they and bring it to checkout and to walk out empty handed. Now I have to order from app and drive back 30mins another day to pick it up? Not happy with this whole experience. Even the store manager said nope she can't do anything even when I showed the lower price on my phone from their compan

Says app no longer supported on tablet, must delete app. Have used app for years with fairly good success until today. I use 2 different tablets and my phone with the app almost daily in my business. Can't imagine why the app is no longer for use with a tablet, online only now. This is a major setback and will affect my business estimates when using Home Depot in the future. Very, very unhappy with this decision, guess I will have to check out the local competition for supplies.

Home Depot is great but this app is very bad. A lot of issue (I am using android phone), won't display price and the add to cart button is disappeared. I can't believe it such a big company but can't develop a good app for customers. It used to be good but has a lot of issue for the past couple updates.

Cannot sign in. After entering my email and pressing "Continue", th8s error message appears: "We're sorry. There was a temporary technical issue. Please try again later." This has been going on for a very long time. I don't remember when it started, but I have successfully used the app in the past. My account is active. I can log in via the website but would rather use the app when on my phone.

It used to be great. I am a HEAVY user, several times a day tracking which stores have what I need in stock for the many different jobs I have going on daily. It saved me time by avoiding traveling to a location to only find out it is not in stock. Not only is the stock not listed for a particular location, but the prices for items on the product description page is no longer visible. Prices for everything have disappeared. Please fix ASAP- Thanks

The app isn't flawless so sometimes I choose to go to the main page to look at things. It constantly reverts me back to the app which I am trying to avoid. That's annoying. In this case, the rental page on the app fails to load after picking an item to look at.

This app was very helpful and great to have. But as of the last few updates, it is complete trash. It Doesn't fully load the page ever, and sometimes not at all. Not being able to add things to the cart or buy things. This is just tip on how its a downgrade of what it was. I've missed out on quite a few flash sales due to this.

The Home Depot app is no longer supported for tablet devices. Find all your project needs on our website*. *Youâ€™ll need to delete the app on your device. Why all of a sudden? It seems to be working in the background but gives you a popup with that message. Uninstalling and reinstalling made no difference.

Forcing the download of an app is idiotic. If you can send me a text saying my order is ready and to download the app, why can't it just have the check in options on it? Check in on the app is not easily visible either, you have to go multiple levels in to your order to get to it. Very poor customer experience, not everything needs an app.

I can't access my home Depot rewards QR code after the last update. I was able to to just tap PROx on my app and now I get a menu with a bunch of nonsense that doesn't even have my QR code to get rewards. So frustrating! Then when I try to remove multiple items from my shopping cart the app freezes and I have to close it and open again and keep removing. Why fix something that ain't broke?

Had great difficulty accessing my account. Turns out that my old email address isn't recognized as valid anymore. Once I was able to find the current email for my account, I just had to log out of the old one and in with the new email. After that, navigating through the app was much easier. I was able to place my order for free delivery.

Very fast and intuitive app. Very well laid out and designed. Tons of useful and productive features like Store Mode and Barcode Scanner! I also really really like that I can see the exact Aisle & Bay where a product is located in a specific Home Depot store. It even tells me the EXACT QUANTITY of the product in stock at any store I choose! it is so so so useful to know in advance, because oftentimes, I want to buy several of the same product (e.g. rolls of tape).
App improves with time. I seem to have difficulty staying in my searches. After I view an item, it takes me back to the home page and I have to search again.

The Home Depot has a very poorly organized inventory system. Not physical inventory but appears to be counted and reordered by items going through checkout. Good in theory, terrible in reality. Internet purchasing is a nightmare with products showing 'in stock', but in reality, not in stock or not anywhere near published inventory amounts in stock. This is such a waste of a contractors time, especially when quite a distance from local store.

Great app for finding the aisle for the product you want and doing price checks. I also use it to read product reviews before purchasing. All my online purchasing experiences have been great. I love the fact that all your receipts are accessible on the app so if you lose the printed receipt you always have a copy.

Complicated ordering when using a gift card. Just finding where to input the gift card info was time-consuming. Cannot use PayPal to pay the remainder of balance once you click on the gift card option. You have to put in all credit card info in order to pay the balance. Also, why do I have to pay $29 shipping for my item when it isn't my fault they do not have ship-to-store or store-pickup available?

Well, I loved the app when it was compatible with my tablet. Someone at Home Depot dropped the ball on this decision. The tablet app is far easier to view than the phone app, and that's why I used it. I can't imagine that this was a cost saving effort, but I'd sure like to hear an explanation supporting this, in my opinion, poor decision.

Constant issues with this app lately. Items fail to be added to the cart, the cart won't always load, and there are issues with checkout. The last four times I've used the app for ordering, it was unsuccessful.

website is super to navigate! Making credit card payments is incredibly difficult! I just bought one item!I knew exactly what I wanted but it still took me about 5 times longer to check out and pay versus Amazon's system.

my experience is great I have no issues with it it's just being there in person especially the one on Sunset in Alamo Heights San Antonio Texas they are the slowest route is most inconsiderate group of workers while I'm standing there waiting on somebody to come and help me it's three cashiers standing in front of you on the phone people walking by back and forth on the phone and the person who works in the hardware department is not answering the call to come help
